title: How to Watch the 2019 Emmys
text:
On Sunday, the 71st Primetime Emmy Awards will take a cue from this year’s Oscars and proceed without a host at the Microsoft Theater in Los Angeles. Will Fleabag sweep the Comedy category? Will Julia Louis-Dreyfus become the performer with the most Emmys ever? Will Game of Thrones somehow anger a substantial portion of the internet, no matter what it does or doesn’t win? You’ll have to tune in to find out; here’s how to watch or live stream the Emmys this weekend, whether you’re a cable-cutter or simply turning on your TV.

What time do the Emmy Awards air?

The Emmys will air this Sunday, September 22, at 8 p.m. ET on FOX. Check out Vogue’s red carpet coverage starting at 7 p.m. ET here.

How do I watch the Emmy Awards?

Cable subscribers can tune into the live broadcast via Fox.com or the FOX NOW app.

How can I stream the Emmy Awards online?

If you’ve cut the cable-company cord like a good millennial, don't worry—you can still use streaming services to watch the awards online. The show will also be available on PlayStation Vue, Hulu with Live TV, YouTube TV, and AT&T TV.

When you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.

Originally Appeared on Vogue
description: On Sunday, the 71st Primetime Emmy Awards will take place in Los Angeles. Here’s how to watch the show if you’re not on the ground.
